title.narrative: UY Promoting Innovation to Enhance Competitiveness

description.narrative: The Project Development Objective (PDO) is to strengthen Uruguay's capacity to generate, transfer and adapt knowledge and technology by supporting: (i) the institutional framework for science, technology, and innovation (STI); (ii) investments in human capital and high-quality research teams; (iii) technology transfer and private sector innovation; and (iv) cross-sectoral and international research collaboration and mobility of researchers between public institutions and the productive sector.

provider-org.narrative: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development

condition.narrative: The Borrower shall furnish to the Bank 2 Project Progress Reports per year in accordance with the provisions of Section 5.08 oftheGeneral Conditions, no later than one month after the covered period
The Borrower shall furnish to the Bank its Financial Statements audited in accordance with the provisions of Section 5.09 (b) ofthe Gen Cond., not later than six months after the end of such period.
The Borrower shall prepare and furnish to the Bank as part of the Project Report, interim unaudited financial reports for theProject covering the calendar semester, satisfactory to the Bank.
The Borrower shall present to the Bank a transition plan to transfer Project Implementation to the ANII, including staffing andother requirements.

title.narrative: Number of international co-authored articles per researchers in project-supported research teams

comment.narrative: The end target value is expected to be 20% higher than year 1 (baseline)

title.narrative: Annual SCI publications per researchers in project-supported research teams

comment.narrative: The end target value is expected to be 10% higher than year 1 (baseline)

title.narrative: Average time to process grant proposals between call for proposals and final selection

comment.narrative: 197 days on average from call for proposals to award.
Three technology Centers have been approved by the Board of Directors of ANII, but are not yet operational.

title.narrative: Number of Technological Demand Support Projects
Number of students completing technical tertiary training supported by the project (cumulative)

comment.narrative: This indicator will be measured at the end of the Project. Tertiary training courses last from one to three years. In 2011 therewere 222 students in first year and 143 in second
This indicator will be measured at the end of the Project.
This indicator will be measured at the end of the Project.

title.narrative: Completion rate of project-supported students in the program allotted timeframe

comment.narrative: This is calculated through a Structural Query Language (SQL) query based on: (i) the universe of students that have concludedtheirprojects (716 students); (ii) the time since scholarship initiation, (iii); the average time oftertiary trainingduration(i.e.24months); and (iv) anestimated averageadditional time tocomplete the finalresearch (i.e. 3months since once thescholarship has ended, students have one month to prepare the final report, and it takes one additional month for its evaluationand finally there are additional delays to process the payment of the final 10% of the scholarship). Based on the calculationsdescribed above, 27 months are considered as the program allotted timeframe.

title.narrative: Number of evaluation studies performed and or contracted by the National Observatory (cumulative)
Private sector cash contributions to supported public-private research partnerships
Number of graduate programs strengthened with support from the project (cumulative)
Number of formal links (with written contract/agreement) created to support Networks
Number of informal links (without written contract/agreement) created to support Networks
Number of monitoring indicators tracked annually based on reliable methodologies (annual)
Number of project-supported researchers inserted into industry (cumulative)
Number of sectoral technological networks established
Number of entities/companies/institutions participating in the alliances supported
Number of graduate programs created with support from the project (cumulative)
Number of scholarships awarded to young researchers by the project
Number of graduates from domestic masters and PhD programs (annual)
Number of internationally published scientific articles (Scopus) (cumulative)
Number of articles downloaded from TIMBO portal (annual)

comment.narrative: Downloads for the period between January and December 2012. During the period between January and July 2013 124,073 articles weredownloaded. This indicates that the pace is similar to the one for last year. Final numbers for 2013 will be available on January2014.

title.narrative: Number of technological innovations/process improvements developed by subprojects under Component 3 (Centers, Networks, StimulatingTechnological Demand Projects, Alliances)

comment.narrative: Four technological innovations have been developed under Public-Private Sector Alliances related to the biotechnology sector. Theinnovations are focused on innovation processes (including standardized protocols and tests) that generate cost savings throughhigher levels of efficiency and allow the companies involved to apply Good Manufacturing Practices (GMP). These innovationsweresuccessfully tested and could be transferred to industry in the short term. During the next implementation support mission, theBank Team will corroborate what is the level of adoption of these innovations by the productive sector.
